com.vangav.backend.play_framework.controllers_generator.json

Class ControllersJson

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vangav.backend.play_framework.controllers_generator.json.ControllersJson

  • public class ControllersJson
extends java.lang.Object
    ControllersJson represents all controllers of a backend

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean after_processing
      after_processing is used to enable doing further processing for a request after a response is sent.
      boolean after_response
      after_response is used to switch on/off all after response operations (each of those operation has a switch property whose value only matters if this property's value is true)
      boolean analysis
      analysis is used to enable doing analysis after requests
      boolean authenticate
      authenticate is used to authenticate a request (e.g.: OAuth 2, Facebook Login, etc ...)
      boolean check_source
      check_source is used to check the request source for device-specific operations (e.g.: if a mobile app backend wants to reject requests coming from computers to potentially try to cause some harm) also used for specific-client applications (like mobile apps) to verify client (using request hashing with a secret phrase or else)
      ControllerJson[] controllers
      controllers reprsents all backend controllers
      boolean default_operations
      default_operations are used to execute operations that happen after each request regardless of the type of that request (e.g.: in a mobile app default operations can be used to update the user's notifications' badge number; for example to reset it on the backend side since a request means that the user opened the app)
      java.lang.String java_package
      java_package is usually the reverse of the project's domain name (e.g.: com.vangav is the reverse of vangav.com) it serves as a unique identifier for the set of projects related to that domain name in order to avoid conflicts with other libraries
      boolean logging
      logging is used to enable logging requests, responses, exceptions, etc ...
      boolean notifications
      notifications is used to enable sending push notifications
      boolean throttle
      throttle is a common need for mobile applications and websites to ban behavior like spam, DOS, etc ...
      boolean validate_param
      validate_param is used to validate a request (e.g.: validate e-mail format, photo size, etc ...)

    • Field Detail

      • java_package

        public java.lang.String java_package
        java_package is usually the reverse of the project's domain name (e.g.: com.vangav is the reverse of vangav.com) it serves as a unique identifier for the set of projects related to that domain name in order to avoid conflicts with other libraries

      • check_source

        public boolean check_source
        check_source is used to check the request source for device-specific operations (e.g.: if a mobile app backend wants to reject requests coming from computers to potentially try to cause some harm) also used for specific-client applications (like mobile apps) to verify client (using request hashing with a secret phrase or else)

      • throttle

        public boolean throttle
        throttle is a common need for mobile applications and websites to ban behavior like spam, DOS, etc ...

      • validate_param

        public boolean validate_param
        validate_param is used to validate a request (e.g.: validate e-mail format, photo size, etc ...)

      • authenticate

        public boolean authenticate
        authenticate is used to authenticate a request (e.g.: OAuth 2, Facebook Login, etc ...)

      • after_response

        public boolean after_response
        after_response is used to switch on/off all after response operations (each of those operation has a switch property whose value only matters if this property's value is true)

      • after_processing

        public boolean after_processing
        after_processing is used to enable doing further processing for a request after a response is sent. (e.g.: let's say someone shared a public post on Facebook, before a response is sent this post must be made to appear for that user's friends which is critical for a successful post; then in after processing the post gets assigned to more non-friend users which if failed doesn't affect the success of the request from the user-experience point of view)

      • default_operations

        public boolean default_operations
        default_operations are used to execute operations that happen after each request regardless of the type of that request (e.g.: in a mobile app default operations can be used to update the user's notifications' badge number; for example to reset it on the backend side since a request means that the user opened the app)

      • notifications

        public boolean notifications
        notifications is used to enable sending push notifications

      • analysis

        public boolean analysis
        analysis is used to enable doing analysis after requests

      • logging

        public boolean logging
        logging is used to enable logging requests, responses, exceptions, etc ...

      • controllers

        public ControllerJson[] controllers
        controllers reprsents all backend controllers
